text: I used to think that some people are lucky until I listened to the speech given by Harsha Bogle on luck he said that luck is the opportunity to do something which you were doing your entire life which you were working hard for and yeah that is luck so in order to be lucky you have to work hard he said that so by working hard one day you will get the opportunity and you have to capitalize on it so that you that would be your lucky day yeah that's it

traits.details: The text lacks references to creative thinking, fantasy, or a preference for imaginative scenarios. There are no words or phrases associated with creativity and imagination, indicating a more practical and factual approach.

The text shows some openness to new ideas and experiences through the mention of capitalizing on opportunities, but it primarily focuses on the importance of hard work and preparation, indicating a balance between convention and novelty.

The text conveys a sense of confidence and self-assurance, implying that one's hard work will eventually lead to opportunities and success, reflecting a strong belief in personal effectiveness and control over outcomes.
The text lacks clear signs of taking charge, expressing opinions, or leading, instead focusing on the importance of hard work and preparation, suggesting a more reserved or passive attitude.
